flawed_nl_solution:
On the eastern part of the campsite, Mr Manuel counted 2*100 = <<2*100=200>>200 tents
The total number of tents in the eastern and the northern part of the campgrounds is 200+100 = <<200+100=300>>300
There are four times as many tents as the northernmost part in the central part of the campsite, which means there are 4*100 = <<4*100=4000>>4000 tents in the central part of the camp.
The total number of tents in the three parts of the campsite is 4000+300 = <<4000+300=4300>>4300
If you add the number of tents Mr. Manuel counted at the southern part of the campsite, you get 4300+200 = <<4300+200=4500>>4500 tents on the whole campsite
#### 4500

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 400, not 4000. It appears an extra zero was added to the number.
